contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox River | river_name = Var | image_name = Entrevaux-rooftops.jpg | caption = Rooftops of [[Entrevaux]] and the gorge of the Var. | origin = [[Maritime Alps]] | mouth = [[Mediterranean Sea]]<br>{{coord|43|39|13|N|7|11|59|E|name=Mediterranean Sea-Var|display=inline,title}} | basin_countries = [[France]] | length = 114 km | elevation = 1800 m | discharge = 50-100 m³/s | watershed = 2,742 km² }} The '''Var''' (Latin ''Varus'') is a [[river]] located in the southeast of [[France]]. The name ''Var'' originates from the [[Ligurian language (ancient)|Ligurian]] word for ''waterway''.{{Fact|date=February 2007}} The Var flows through the [[Alpes-Maritimes]] ''[[département in France|département]]'' for most of its length, with a short (~15 km or ~9 mi) stretch in the [[Alpes-de-Haute-Provence]] département. It is a unique case in France of a river not flowing in the ''département'' named after it (see [[Var (département)|Var]]). The Var rises near the [[Col de la Cayolle]] (2,326 m/7,631 ft) in the [[Maritime Alps]] and flows generally southeast for {{convert|114|km|mi}} into the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]] between [[Nice]] and [[Saint-Laurent-du-Var]]. The Var flows through the following départements and towns: *[[Alpes-Maritimes]]: [[Guillaumes]] *[[Alpes-de-Haute-Provence]]: [[Entrevaux]] *[[Alpes-Maritimes]]: [[Puget-Théniers]], [[Carros]], [[Saint-Laurent-du-Var]] ==References== *http://www.geoportail.fr *[http://sandre.eaufrance.fr/app/chainage/courdo/htm/Y6--0200.php?cg=Y6--0200 The Var at the Sandre database] {{Commons category|Var River|Var River}} [[Category:Rivers of France]] [[Category:Var basin|*]] [[Category:Geography of Alpes-de-Haute-Provence]] [[Category:Geography of Alpes-Maritimes]] [[Category:Rivers of Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur]] {{Provence-geo-stub}}
